so you're using su or something to log in as another user in the terminal, then running the apps from the command line?
yes
Are the apps starting, showing a window, and later dying or just never showing a display?
nope not showing any display, just die with segmentation fault

try running `xhost +[user you run apps as]` from a terminal that is the user you're logged into X as.  (NOT recommended if this is a production/server machine, as I've heard xhost is not the most secure way to grant access, but I think it would be fine here)

workaround: don't put blank media in drive.  :-p   Hrmm, that's very odd.  You're not running a full gnome session as the other user or anything like that are you?

I'd check dmesg for a possible error message.  You could always run the app through ssh, which would probably fix the problem
please explain what you mean by through ssh?
log into your machine by doing "ssh -Y user@localhost" and run the application from that terminal

the only problem would be if the performance of the GUI goes all to crap, but it's worth a shot.
